french: On appelle anneau tout triplet \((A,+,\times)\) où \(A\) est un ensemble et + et \(\times\) des lois de composition internes telles que :
• \((A,+)\) soit un groupe abélien dont le neutre se note \(0_A\) et s'appelle l'élement nul ;
• la loi \(\times\) est associative : \( \forall (x,y,z)\in A^3,\; x\times y\times z = (x\times y)\times z = x \times (y\times z)\) ;
• Il existe un élément \(1_A\) tel que \(\forall x \in A,\; 1_A\times x=x\times 1_A=x\) ;
• La multiplication est distributive par rapport à l'addition, c'est à dire :
$$ \forall (x,y,z) \in A^3,\; x\times(y+z)=(x\times y) +(x\times z) \quad\text{et}\quad (y+z)\times x = (y\times x)+(z\times x)$$
Si \((A,+,\times)\) est un anneau et que la loi \(\times\) est commutative, on dit que c'est un anneau commutatif.
english: We call ring any triplet \((A,+,\times)\) where \(A\) is a set and + and \(\times\) are binary operators such that:
• \((A,+)\) is an abelian group whose neutral element is denoted \(0_A\);
• the operator \(\times\) is associative: \( \forall (x,y,z)\in A^3,\; x\times y\times z = (x\times y)\times z = x \times (y\times z)\);
• There exist an element \(1_A\) such that \(\forall x \in A,\; 1_A\times x=x\times 1_A=x\);
• The multiplication is distributive with respect to the addition, namely:
$$ \forall (x,y,z) \in A^3,\; x\times(y+z)=(x\times y) +(x\times z) \quad\text{and}\quad (y+z)\times x = (y\times x)+(z\times x)$$
If \((A,+,\times)\) is a ring and the operator \(\times\) is commutative, then it is called a commutative ring.
